DataElement.preferredName: Core Biopsy Fine-Needle Aspiration Sentinel Lymph Node Lymph Node Biopsy Prior Clinical Study Performed Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the having removal of tissue or fluid from the armpit with a needle, either of a small or relatively large diameter, or the biopsy of first lymph node to which cancer is likely to spread, or the core biopsy that is examined under a microscope before the start of a clinical study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Core Biopsy Fine-Needle Aspiration Sentinel Lymph Node Axillary Lymph Node Biopsy Prior Clinical Study Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the having removal of tissue or fluid from the armpit with a needle, either of a small or relatively large diameter, or the biopsy of first lymph node to which cancer is likely to spread, or the core biopsy that is examined under a microscope before the start of a clinical study.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Core Biopsy Fine-Needle Aspiration Sentinel Lymph Node Axillary Lymph Node Biopsy
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle with a relatively large diameter, for microscopic examination.:The removal of tissue or fluid with a needle for examination under a microscope. Also called needle biopsy.:The first lymph node to which cancer is likely to spread from the primary tumor. Cancer cells may appear first in the sentinel node before spreading to other lymph nodes.:Surgical removal of tissues from the lymph nodes located in the cavity beneath the junction of the arm and the thorax (armpit) so that a biopsy can be performed.

Concepts.definition: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle with a relatively large diameter, for microscopic examination.
The removal of tissue or fluid with a thin needle for examination under a microscope.

The first lymph node that is affected by cancer spread from the primary site.  Sentinel lymph node biopsy is part of the staging work-up to determine early metastasis to regional lymph nodes in patients with breast carcinoma or melanoma.
Surgical removal of tissues from the lymph nodes located in the cavity beneath the junction of the arm and the thorax (armpit) so that a biopsy can be performed.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. :Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
